document_title: Benign kidney tumors: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
The causes of benign kidney tumors are very diverse and are still one of the issues of concern to experts. Specifically:
Because patients have kidney diseases, but do not receive timely and correct treatment, kidney tumors appear.; Because patients use drugs that inhibit the enzyme monoamine oxidase to treat depression, stimulants, etc., it causes kidney tumors.; Because the patient has problems related to genetic disorders such as glial fibrosis 1, hereditary disease multiple endocrine neoplasia type 1...; Because patients have unscientific living habits: unhealthy eating, lack of exercise, taking medication incorrectly as prescribed, smoking...
In fact, almost anyone can develop a benign kidney tumor. However, risk factors belong to the group:
For people aged 20-50, the risk tends to increase with age; Men are more susceptible to kidney tumors than women; People often have health problems
People who regularly take medication incorrectly as prescribed are susceptible to kidney tumors.
